JUDGES: Anatoly Kovler;Christos Rozakis;Dean Spielmann;Elisabeth Steiner;George Nicolaou;Khanlar Hajiyev
TEXT: The applicant , PERSON , is a NORP national who was born in DATE and lives in GPE . She is represented before the ORG by Mr M. Rachkovskiy , a lawyer practising in GPE . ORG ( “ the Government ” ) are represented by PERSON , former Representative of ORG at ORG .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .

At DATE the applicant had bone tuberculosis . A resident of PERSON ( a town in LOC ) , in DATE she was assigned disability status and started to receive a disability allowance . In DATE the applicant reached retirement age , and on her request the disability allowance was replaced with an old - age pension .

Considering the pension inadequate , in DATE the applicant asked ORG of GPE to oblige the ORG to upgrade it . On DATE the court rejected the applicant ’s request , because her pension had been calculated in accordance with the law . On CARDINAL DATE ORG upheld this judgment on appeal .

In DATE and DATE the applicant applied to ORG . She attacked the LAW insofar as it allowed pensions below the established subsistence level . The court considered these applications beyond its competence because they required a factual assessment of the applicant ’s welfare and suggested legislative improvements .
In DATE the applicant moved from NORP to GPE .
During her life in NORP in TIME , the applicant ’s DATE income included :
– a pension ( MONEY ( RUB ) ) ;
– social aid ( RUB CARDINAL ) ; and
– compensation for limited ability to work ( RUB CARDINAL ) .
In addition , she enjoyed the following benefits :
– PERCENT discount on utility bills ;
– free public urban and suburban transport ;
– PERCENT discount on interurban rail and air transport ;
– PERCENT discount on telephone and radio bills ;
– free medical assistance ;
– PERCENT discount on medical prescriptions ;
– free sanatorium treatment ; and
– free suburban and interurban transport to the place of the treatment .
Once the applicant received an indigence aid of RUB CARDINAL . The applicant ’s family also benefited from the discount on utility bills . On her request , part of the benefits were monetised .
During her life in GPE from DATE TIME , the applicant ’s DATE income included :
– a pension ( RUB CARDINAL ) ;
– social aid ( RUB CARDINAL ) ;
– compensation for limited ability to work ( RUB CARDINAL ) .
In addition , she enjoyed the following benefits :
– PERCENT discount on utility bills ;
– free public urban and suburban transport ;
– PERCENT discount on interurban rail and air transport ;
– PERCENT discount on telephone and radio bills ;
– free medical assistance ;
– free dental prosthetics ( except precious metals and cermets ) ; and
– free suburban and interurban transport to the place of treatment .
Once the applicant received an indigence aid of RUB CARDINAL . On her request , part of the benefits were monetised .

In GPE each region has its own subsistence level ( прожиточный минимум ) . In LOC and GPE these levels are fixed by LOC Law no . CARDINAL of DATE and GPE ’s Law no . CARDINAL of CARDINAL DATE respectively .

In LOC in CARDINAL–CARDINAL the subsistence level for pensioners was RUB CARDINAL per month . In GPE in CARDINAL the subsistence level for pensioners was RUB CARDINAL per month . There was no special subsistence level for disabled pensioners .
